summary: Apparently only Sansa will have problems with her 😂 Arya, like Jon will see mother lizard as the good person that she is and...
question: Apparently only Sansa will have problems with her 😂 Arya, like Jon will see mother lizard as the good person that she is and look up to her cause their very similar? What even is this logic, where are the brain cells...Twitter I swear 👀
answer:
Dear nonny,

well, people only see what they want to see. I know we are often accused of seeing anything through shipping goggles, but how anyone can think that D and Arya are simliar is beyond me….

Only some weeks left now!

Thanks for the ask!

title: Spring Fortune
body:
Spring Fortune, A SanSan Fanfiction by SharkAria

Summary:  Spring has come to Winterfell, but food supplies are low. Sandor goes on a mission to find more, and he manages to feed the whole castle. Sansa thanks him.

Rating: M (all characters and readers 18+, please!)

Status: Complete one-shot with likely eventual vignette add-ons for the same world :)

Excerpt:  

Sansa shifted closer to him, and the hem of her green velvet gown rustled against his boots. “You deserve a reward,” she murmured close to his ear as the singers finished their tune.

Sandor turned to face her and stared at her lips. Was he imagining it, or was the corner of her mouth pulling upward? An invitation? he wondered. “And what is my reward?” he asked, struggling to keep his voice flat.

She gazed at him steadily. “Name it,” she replied, “and you shall have it.”

###

Posted this one a few days ago but just got around to adding it on Tumblr. Enjoy!

tags: i will never not be proud and in love with sansa stark
summary: Sansa spent her formative years as a political prisoner amongst the people that murdered half her family and managed to survive...
body:
Sansa spent her formative years as a political prisoner amongst the people that murdered half her family and managed to survive it AND learn from it.

She observed and learned from CERSEI and LITTLEFINGER, probably the two most politically intelligent and cunning people around. She learned the subtle art of being a savage from the Tyrells.

She was abused and humilaited by Joffery, and manipulated and betrayed by Littlefinger.

She endured endless rape and abuse from Ramsay in her childhood home and didn’t break.

And then she turned around, learned from her own mistakes and past, escaped, convinced Jon to fight for their home and then WON the Battle of the Bastards and got Winterfell back. She personally saw to the deaths of two (2) of her abusers, ruled Winterfell in Jon’s absense, and has the devotion of the North. Not to mention, how she seems to be the only person left that doesn’t underestimate Cersei’s power and the threat she poses.

Boo hoo that she likes to laugh and wear pretty dresses and doesn’t know how to use a sword. Neither does Cersei and so far she’s the only one to continuously win the throne. Power is power.

I’m just so proud of that bitch. She’s really back home, thriving and surviving with her family again. We truly stan a legend. Wow.

tags: grammarly insists that i change gotladies to hot ladies
summary: Since there is still no trailer, let me tell you how much I like Sansa’s season 7 necklace.  Yes, this one: Not that it’s...
body:
Since there is still no trailer, let me tell you how much I like Sansa’s season 7 necklace. 

Yes, this one:

Not that it’s unexpected — after all, I like almost all of GoT costuming choices. Still, the previous, black version of it was kind of wonky, had an awkward length, and Sophie constantly had to hold the pendant in hand (though I still appreciate it because it allowed Sansa to join Dany and Cersei in their “confident women wear big statement jewellery” club).

But this second version is almost perfect. Worn over the belt with its buckles and shoulder straps, the necklace looks almost like armour. Steel colour of its ring makes Sansa’s connection to the Eyrie and House Arryn more obvious while upholding the Starks aesthetic. Of course, Catelyn didn’t wear chains, but her collars/necklaces also had long “tails”, which she fixed in place with the round silver fibula.

The “needle” pendant doesn’t dangle on the chain but is hooked neatly to the skirt without being a hindrance.

Hanging from the side like this, it looks like a chatelaine that Septa Mordaine wore. Or like a dagger ready to stab the enemy in the face, if you want.

Find yourself a girl that can do both. Gif by gotladies

This construction also inspires associations with necklaces and girdles from the XVII century portraits, making Sansa look regal in her austere dresses and long cloaks.

And of course, we shouldn’t forget that out of the main cast only Sophie with her height could allow herself a piece of jewellery this long.

Tl;dr: this necklace is perfect as it conveys Sansa’s character journey and the different sides of her personality. Also, it’s stylish and shiny.

summary: Now that it seems obvious that they are so many callback moments that are going to occur, I honestly believe that episode 1 of...
body: Now that it seems obvious that they are so many callback moments that are going to occur, I honestly believe that episode 1 of season 8 is going to hit us with a major twist right off the gate just like episode 1 of season 1! I think the show is taking the season 1 callbacks very seriously as they should so that the story can wrap up nicely. It might be related to Jon and Sansa or it might not be but either way whatever they do it will be a major shock to our system and will set the season off right!!

summary: Have you ever had a character whose only eligible in story love interest possibilities simply weren't good enough, that you are...
question: Have you ever had a character whose only eligible in story love interest possibilities simply weren't good enough, that you are forced to try and find their match in a completely different verse altogether? That's me with Sansa.
answer: I noticed that in the tag. Sansa is pretty hard to ship, most of the characters she interacts with are either adults and/or abusive and/or they used her. There are few characters that don’t fit into that but they barely have any content.

summary: okay .... i have recently gotten into game of thrones.... .. can you educate me on sansa and arya. i know you love sansa and i...
question: okay .... i have recently gotten into game of thrones.... .. can you educate me on sansa and arya. i know you love sansa and i feel like later-seasons-arya is dubbed a weirdo on this website and i am longing to know why. i need all the details on my girls and dont know where to turn
answer: anon i literally typed out 5 paragraphs for you but then i read them over and they didn’t make any sense so instead i give you this meme and my executive summary which is that: both stark sisters are kind, courageous, intelligent people who love their family deeply and both of them are oppressed by society’s constructs of femininity in different ways and despite this they both find strength in their relationships to other women and value in themselves and i love them both deeply, hence:

blog.title: Vermilion Sunrise
blog.description:
My inner muse made me do it — all of it

Same name as my AO3 account

title: A Late Night Wager - Vermilion_Sunrise - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]

description:
Chapters: 5/7
Fandom: A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms, Game of Thrones (TV)
Rating: Explicit
Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
Relationships: Sandor Clegane/Sansa Stark, Sandor Clegane & Sansa Stark
Characters: Sansa Stark, Sandor Clegane
Additional Tags: Great night, Rough Sex, fun sex, Good Memory, Sober Shenanigans, He’ll never remember, How drunk is he?, Bets & Wagers, POV Sansa Stark, sansan, Drinking, Teasing, Sexual Pleasure
Series: Part 2 of Wicked Westerosi Wagers
Summary:

Westerosi A/U, SanSan: There’s a lot to celebrate in Westeros, the Night King has been defeated and Jon is throwing a feast in Winterfell. Intent on keeping Sandor close, Sansa requests he become her Sworn Sword. In the events that follow that evening she will come to realize he has harboured the same feelings for her as she as for him – and a night of pure sexual plesure will follow. A late night wager made in the throws of passion will give Sansa something to tease her new found lover with.

This will be paired with another story called “An Early Morning Wager” which will be from Sandor’s point of view. The idea is that the stories stand alone, but are best if read together – meaning chapter for chapter. I will link them once the other is up too.

After a bit of inspiration, I had to update the other side of the story ;-)
